title: Ticket #553: condor_compile & libtool lossage
description:
Please see ticket for details.

In short, condor_compiling a tool with libtool produces unexpected errors.

After an extended conversation in the ticket, the bug has been found to be a misbehavior of condor_compile when certain arguments are passed to the compiler. The fix should be quick now that I know what it is.

Milestones

  • 1/20/2010 [DONE]
    • Fix the bug
remarks:
2010-Jan-20 13:58:53 by psilord:
Fixed on V7_4-branch, merged to master, documented, committed. Done.
check_ins:
2010-Jan-20 13:56   Check-in [25220]: Added a blurb about the fix for ticket #553. (By Peter Keller )
2010-Jan-20 13:53   Check-in [16934]: Addef --version for the list of compiler flags which don't elicit an unable to link with our internal ld error. #553 (By Peter Keller )
2010-Jan-20 13:34   Check-in [16931]: Fixed a bug where condor_compile would die with the "ld not in use error" when legitimately using gcc to perform tasks that don't result in an executable. An example is: condor_compile gcc -print-prog-name=ld In this case, condor_compile should just emit the correct information and not die with the error [...] (By Peter Keller )
creator: psilord
